partners.headline: Partner Pathways
partners.description: Your gateway to professional recognition. Explore pathways to join Nigeria's premier mining and geoscience professional bodies.

bodies.name: Nigerian Mining and Geosciences Society
bodies.description: The foremost professional body for mining and geoscience professionals in Nigeria.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Geology, Mining, or related field
Payment of registration and annual dues

steps.title: Download Application Form
steps.description: Get the official NMGS membership application form from the resources section.

steps.title: Gather Documents
steps.description: Prepare your degree certificate, transcript, passport photos, and recommendation letters.

steps.title: Submit Application
steps.description: Submit completed form and documents to the NMGS secretariat or your chapter coordinator.

steps.title: Pay Dues
steps.description: Complete payment of registration fee (₦15,000) and annual dues (₦10,000).

steps.title: Await Approval
steps.description: Applications are reviewed monthly. Approval takes 2-4 weeks.

bodies.name: Council of Mining Engineers and Geoscientists
bodies.description: The regulatory body for mining engineering and geoscience practice in Nigeria.

steps.title: Verify Eligibility
steps.description: Ensure you meet the minimum experience requirement and have current NMGS membership.

steps.title: Complete Assessment
steps.description: Pass the professional competency assessment conducted by COMEG.

steps.title: Submit Portfolio
steps.description: Provide evidence of professional work including project reports and references.

steps.title: Interview
steps.description: Attend the professional interview with the COMEG licensing board.

steps.title: Receive License
steps.description: Upon approval, receive your professional license and certificate.

bodies.name: Society of Petroleum Engineers
bodies.description: The largest individual-member organization serving professionals in the oil and gas industry.
benefits: Access to technical papers and journals

steps.title: Create SPE Account
steps.description: Visit spe.org and create your personal account with valid student email.

steps.title: Apply for Student Membership
steps.description: Select student membership category and complete the online application.

steps.title: Pay Dues
steps.description: Student membership costs $25 annually with access to all digital resources.

steps.title: Join Local Section
steps.description: Connect with the Nigeria section and your university's SPE student chapter.

chapters.headline: Chapter Directory
chapters.description: Explore NMGS chapters across Nigerian universities. Find your school, connect with executives, and discover your department's community.

department.name: Department of Geosciences
department.description: The Department of Geosciences at the University of Lagos was established in 1962 as one of the pioneer departments in the Faculty of Science. The department offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in Geology and Geophysics, producing some of Nigeria's finest geoscientists who work in oil and gas, mining, environmental consulting, and academia.
department.address: Department of Geosciences, University of Lagos, Akoka, Yaba, Lagos

hod.name: Prof. Adebayo Oluwole
hod.title: Professor of Petroleum Geology
hod.message: Welcome to the Department of Geosciences. Our mission is to train world-class geoscientists equipped with the knowledge and skills to tackle Nigeria's resource challenges. We encourage all our students to actively participate in NMGS activities as part of their professional development.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.description: The Department of Geology at the University of Ibadan is one of the oldest and most prestigious geology departments in Nigeria, established in 1948. The department has produced numerous leaders in the oil and gas industry, mining sector, and academia, maintaining a strong tradition of excellence in geoscience education and research.
department.address: Department of Geology, University of Ibadan, Ibadan, Oyo State

hod.name: Prof. Olukayode Taiwo
hod.title: Professor of Structural Geology
hod.message: The Department of Geology continues to uphold its tradition of academic excellence. We are proud of our NMGS chapter and encourage active student participation in professional activities that prepare them for successful careers.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.faculty: Faculty of Earth and Environmental Sciences
department.description: ABU's Department of Geology is one of the largest in Nigeria, known for producing top-tier geoscientists. The department has strong research focus on solid mineral exploration and has partnerships with various mining companies across northern Nigeria.
department.address: Department of Geology, Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna State

hod.name: Prof. Abubakar Sani
hod.title: Professor of Mining Geology
hod.message: ABU Geology department has been at the forefront of mineral resource development in Nigeria. Our NMGS chapter is the largest in the country, and we take pride in preparing students for impactful careers in the geoscience sector.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.description: UNN's Department of Geology has a rich history dating back to 1960. The department is known for groundbreaking research in coal geology and the sedimentary basins of southeastern Nigeria. Our graduates serve in leading positions across the oil and gas industry.
department.address: Department of Geology, University of Nigeria, Nsukka, Enugu State

hod.name: Prof. Emeka Nwachukwu
hod.title: Professor of Coal Geology
hod.message: UNN Geology department continues to lead in research and teaching excellence. We strongly support NMGS activities and encourage our students to take advantage of networking and professional development opportunities.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.description: Located in the heart of Nigeria's oil-producing region, UNIPORT's Geology department has strong ties to the petroleum industry. Students benefit from proximity to major oil companies and regular field trips to exploration sites in the Niger Delta.
department.address: Department of Geology, University of Port Harcourt, Choba, Rivers State

hod.name: Prof. Godwin Akpan
hod.title: Professor of Petroleum Geology
hod.message: Our location gives students unparalleled access to the Nigerian oil and gas industry. We work closely with Shell, Total, and Chevron to provide internship and career opportunities for our students.

department.name: Department of Applied Geology
department.faculty: School of Earth and Mineral Sciences
department.description: FUTA's Applied Geology department focuses on practical applications of geological knowledge in mining, petroleum, and environmental sectors. The program emphasizes hands-on training and fieldwork.
department.address: Department of Applied Geology, FUTA, Akure, Ondo State

hod.name: Prof. Adekunle Oladipo
hod.title: Professor of Applied Geophysics
hod.message: At FUTA, we believe in learning by doing. Our students gain extensive field experience that prepares them for real-world challenges in the geoscience industry.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.faculty: Faculty of Earth and Environmental Sciences
department.description: BUK's Geology department serves students from across northern Nigeria, with particular strength in groundwater studies and basement geology relevant to the region's mineral resources.
department.address: Department of Geology, Bayero University, Kano, Kano State

hod.name: Prof. Mahmud Abubakar
hod.title: Professor of Hydrogeology
hod.message: BUK Geology focuses on solving water and mineral resource challenges facing northern Nigeria. Our students are trained to make meaningful contributions to sustainable development.

department.name: Department of Geology
department.description: FUTO's Geology department combines technical rigor with practical field training. The department has strong research programs in petroleum geology and environmental geoscience.
department.address: Department of Geology, FUTO, Owerri, Imo State

hod.name: Prof. Chinedu Okonkwo
hod.title: Professor of Environmental Geology
hod.message: We are committed to producing environmentally conscious geoscientists who understand the balance between resource extraction and sustainability.

internships.headline: Internships & SIWES Placements
internships.description: Discover verified internship and SIWES opportunities from industry partners. Each listing includes detailed information on stipends, accommodation, and application requirements.

listings.accommodationDetails: Shared accommodation in company residential area with meals included
listings.description: Join Shell's exploration team and gain hands-on experience in petroleum geology, seismic interpretation, and reservoir characterization. You'll work alongside senior geologists on active projects in the Niger Delta basin.
requirements: Currently enrolled in 300 Level or above in Geology/Geophysics

applicationSteps.title: Online Application
applicationSteps.description: Visit shell.com.ng/careers and complete the online application form. Upload your CV, transcript, and NMGS membership certificate.

applicationSteps.title: Aptitude Test
applicationSteps.description: Shortlisted candidates will be invited to take an online aptitude test covering numerical reasoning, verbal reasoning, and technical knowledge.

applicationSteps.title: Technical Interview
applicationSteps.description: Successful candidates will have a virtual interview with the geology team to assess technical knowledge and fit.

applicationSteps.title: Medical Examination
applicationSteps.description: Selected candidates must pass a medical examination at a Shell-approved hospital.

applicationSteps.title: Onboarding
applicationSteps.description: Complete safety training and documentation before starting your placement.

listings.accommodationDetails: Free accommodation in company guest house within the plant premises
listings.description: Work with our mining operations team on quarry planning, blast design, and mineral processing at Africa's largest cement plant. Gain exposure to large-scale mining operations and modern processing techniques.
requirements: Mining Engineering, Geology, or related discipline
Willingness to relocate to Kogi State
Basic computer skills (MS Office, AutoCAD is a plus)
Strong work ethic and eagerness to learn
benefits: Three meals daily at company canteen

applicationSteps.title: Email Application
applicationSteps.description: Send your CV and cover letter to careers@dangotecement.com with subject 'Mining Intern Application - [Your Name]'.

applicationSteps.title: Document Verification
applicationSteps.description: Submit copies of your student ID, transcript, and recommendation letter from your HOD.

applicationSteps.title: Phone Interview
applicationSteps.description: A brief phone screening to assess your interest and availability.

applicationSteps.title: Offer Letter
applicationSteps.description: Successful candidates receive offer letters with reporting instructions.

listings.description: Comprehensive graduate program covering geological mapping, mineral resource assessment, and geohazard studies across Nigeria. Trainees rotate through different divisions and participate in nationwide field projects.
requirements: Fresh graduate or final year student in Geology or related field
First Class or Second Class Upper degree

applicationSteps.title: Online Registration
applicationSteps.description: Register on the NGSA recruitment portal at ngsa.gov.ng/careers.

applicationSteps.title: Document Upload
applicationSteps.description: Upload degree certificate, transcript, NYSC certificate, and birth certificate.

applicationSteps.title: Written Examination
applicationSteps.description: Computer-based test covering geology fundamentals, current affairs, and general aptitude.

applicationSteps.title: Oral Interview
applicationSteps.description: Panel interview with senior geologists at NGSA headquarters in Abuja.

applicationSteps.title: Background Check
applicationSteps.description: Security clearance and verification of credentials.

listings.description: Hands-on experience with seismic data processing, interpretation, and reservoir modeling using industry-standard software like Petrel and Kingdom.
requirements: Knowledge of Petrel or similar software is a plus
Ability to work in a team environment

applicationSteps.title: Apply Online
applicationSteps.description: Submit application through TotalEnergies Nigeria career portal.

applicationSteps.title: Technical Assessment
applicationSteps.description: Online assessment covering geophysics fundamentals.

applicationSteps.title: Interview
applicationSteps.description: Virtual interview with the geophysics team.

listings.accommodationDetails: No accommodation provided - Lagos based candidates preferred
listings.description: Support environmental impact assessments, soil and water sampling, and contamination studies for oil and mining projects across Nigeria.
requirements: Valid driver's license is a plus

applicationSteps.title: Email Application
applicationSteps.description: Send CV and cover letter to careers@ermng.com.

applicationSteps.title: Interview
applicationSteps.description: In-person interview at Lagos office.

listings.accommodationDetails: Fully furnished shared apartments in company residential estate with gym and recreation facilities
listings.description: Rotate through drilling, production, and reservoir engineering departments with mentorship from senior engineers. Gain exposure to offshore and onshore operations.
requirements: Willingness to work in Warri location

applicationSteps.title: Apply Online
applicationSteps.description: Create profile and apply at chevron.com/careers.

applicationSteps.title: Online Tests
applicationSteps.description: Complete cognitive ability and technical assessments.

applicationSteps.title: Video Interview
applicationSteps.description: Recorded video interview answering preset questions.

applicationSteps.title: Assessment Center
applicationSteps.description: Full-day assessment including group exercises and panel interview in Lagos.

applicationSteps.title: Medical & Documentation
applicationSteps.description: Medical fitness test and security documentation.
